intro: Lepervenchea pauciramosa, commonly known as the sparse-branched vine, is a climbing plant characterized by its slender stems and few lateral branches. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is native to certain regions of South America. The plant features small, trifoliate leaves and produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fibrous roots and woody stems make it adaptable to various soil types and environmental conditions. Lepervenchea pauciramosa is often found in moist, shaded areas within tropical and subtropical forests.
